thread.title: Liverpool defender Jon Flanagan could return to Anfield as Burnley boss Sean Dyche reveals Clarets will 'monitor' his loan
thread.title_full: Liverpool defender Jon Flanagan could return to Anfield as Burnley boss Sean Dyche reveals Clarets will 'monitor' his loan

author: James Whaling
title: Liverpool defender Jon Flanagan could return to Anfield as Burnley boss Sean Dyche reveals Clarets will 'monitor' his loan
text:
Sport Liverpool defender Jon Flanagan could return to Anfield as Burnley boss Sean Dyche reveals Clarets will 'monitor' his loan Flanagan moved to Turf Moor in the summer on a season-long agreement, but has made just three Premier League starts with a further two substitute appearances Share Flanagan could return to Anfield (Photo: Ian MacNicol / Getty) Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
Liverpool defender Jon Flanagan could return to Anfield after Burnley boss Sean Dyche revealed the Clarets will 'monitor' the full-back's loan deal. 
Flanagan moved to Turf Moor in the summer on a season-long agreement, but has made just three Premier League starts with a further two substitute appearances. 
He is continuing to regain full fitness after spending 18 months on the sidelines with a knee problem, returning during the second half of last season. 
Flanagan was ruled out for part of the festive period with another knee injury, but it is understood not to be serious. Dyche has admitted Burnley will 'monitor' Flanagan's situation (Photo: Alex Livesey) Klopp gave Flanagan eight appearances in the second half of last season (Photo: REUTERS) 
“It takes time to come through injuries, we’ve seen that with Vokesy (Sam Vokes), he’s looking a different player now compared to six months after his injury,” Dyche said. 
“We knew there’d be an adaptation period for Flanno. He knows about the players now and how we operate as a team, on the training pitch and I think that’s done him some good so he’s closer to where he wants to be.
